headline: Mag 7 plus Oracle equals GAMMATON! Strategist talks tech acronym.
summary: What do you get when you add one more Big Tech stock to the Magnificent Seven? The answer is GAMMATON! Interactive Brokers chief strategist Steve Sosnick explains his newest acronym for prospective AI and tech picks, GAMMATON, which consists of Alphabet (GOOGL, GOOG), Apple (AAPL), Microsoft (MSFT), Meta Platforms (META), Amazon (AMZN), Tesla (TSLA), Oracle (ORCL), and Nvidia (NVDA). Also hear Steve Sosnick elaborate on whether AI investors should pivot from Nvidia (NVDA) into Oracle after the latter's colossal stock gain this week. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Nvidia to scale back DGX Cloud Business, The Information reports
summary: Nvidia (NVDA) is scaling back its DGX Cloud business, reducing efforts to compete with Amazon Web Services (AMZN), The Information’s Anissa Gardizy reports, citing a person familiar with the situation. Instead, it will primarily use the service internally to support its researchers in chip design and AI model development. headline: Is Amazon Stock Attractive Following Recent AI Partnership Announcement?
summary: Thinking about what to do with Amazon.com stock? You are not alone. Investors have watched its price move between headlines, tech rallies, and sentiment shifts, all the while trying to gauge whether there is still room for growth. headline: Is Rivian Stock Fairly Priced After Amazon Tests GM BrightDrop Electric Vans?
summary: Deciding what to do with your Rivian Automotive stock right now might feel like you are straddling the line between fear of missing out and lingering market skepticism. Over the past month, Rivian’s share price has jumped 9.6%, only to slip by 5.3% in the last week. Even on a bigger timescale, there is a tale of two charts here: a modest 1.6% gain year-to-date contrasts sharply with a staggering 65.7% drop over the past three years. These swings are not just numbers; they reflect how...

headline: Should the New Amex Partnership Prompt a Rethink of UPS’s (UPS) Small Business Growth Strategy?
summary: On September 10, 2025, American Express and UPS announced an expanded agreement giving small and medium-sized businesses exclusive shipping discounts and service offers ahead of the holiday season, valid through February 2026, via the Amex Business Savings Suite. This partnership highlights UPS's focus on growing its small business segment, which is considered more profitable per package compared to large enterprise clients. We'll examine how targeting small business shipping volume with new...
